keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 19-20, 2019, regarding procurement for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
It references job 120489 and a change in camera part number to V9420-W312MIR due to the original part being discontinued.
The email instructs shipment of surveillance equipment directly to the MCC site.
The correspondence involves SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, a contractor for the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP).
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it relates to surveillance or security measures at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
